intro: Trigonostemon leucanthus var. siamensis, commonly known as the Siam white-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows on the branches of host trees, drawing water and nutrients from them while performing photosynthesis. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, often with a distinct midrib. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique parasitic lifestyle and ecological interactions.
